verses.text: Hear ye the word which the LORD speaketh to you, O house of Israel:
Thus saith the LORD, Learn not the way of the heathen, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the heathen are dismayed at them.
For the customs of the people \add are\add* vain: for \add one\add* cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the ax.
They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it may not move.

They \add are\add* upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither also \add is it\add* in them to do good.
Forasmuch as \add there is\add* none like to thee, O LORD; thou \add art\add* great, and thy name \add is\add* great in might.

Who would not fear thee, O King of nations? for to thee doth it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise \add men\add* of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, \add there is\add* none like to thee.
But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock \add is\add* a doctrine of vanities.

Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder: blue and purple \add is\add* their clothing: they \add are\add* all the work of skillful \add men\add* .
But the LORD \add is\add* the true God, he \add is\add* the living God, and an everlasting king: at his wrath the earth shall tremble, and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.
Thus shall ye say to them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, \add even\add* they shall perish from the earth, and from under these heavens.
He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.

When he uttereth his voice, \add there is\add* a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
Every man is brutish in \add his\add* knowledge: every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image \add is\add* falsehood, and \add there is\add* no breath in them.
They \add are\add* vanity, \add and\add* the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
The portion of Jacob \add is\add* not like them: for he \add is\add* the former of all \add things\add* ; and Israel \add is\add* the rod of his inheritance: The LORD of hosts \add is\add* his name.
Gather up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.
For thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once, and will distress them that they may find \add it so\add* .
Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this \add is\add* a grief, and I must bear it.

My tabernacle is laid waste, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone from me, and they \add are\add* not: \add there is\add* none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.
For the pastors have become brutish, and have not sought the LORD: therefore they shall not prosper, and all their flocks shall be scattered.
Behold, the sound of the noise is come, and a great commotion from the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, \add and\add* a den of dragons.
O LORD, I know that the way of man \add is\add* not in himself: \add it is\add* not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
O LORD, correct me, but with judgment; not in thy anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob, and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.
